description: The object `tabris.app` provides information about the application.

foreground.description: Fired when the app becomes visible. The event is only fired after the app has been brought to the background. Not during app startup.

resume.description: Fired when the app is visible and ready to interact with the user. The event is preceded by either `foreground` (the app becomes visible again) or `pause` (the app regains ability to interact with user).

pause.description: Fired when the app is not the interaction target of the user anymore. Usually preceded by `resume`.

background.description: Fired when the app becomes invisible. Either because another app is in the foreground or the user has returned to the home screen.

terminate.description: Fired when the app is being destroyed. After this callback no more interaction with the app is possible.

backnavigation.description: Fired when the back button is pressed on Android. To suppress the default back navigation behavior, call `event.preventDefault()`.

reload.description: Forces the running application to reload the main module and start over.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of a resource relative to the application root.

getResourceLocation.description: Returns the URL for a given resource that is bundled with the app. Can be used to access app resources like images, videos, etc. Note that these resources can only be accessed in read-only mode.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to fetch a patch from.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback function to be called when the installation has finished or failed. In case of a failure, the callback will receive a parameter `error` that contains an Error object. If the installation succeeds, this parameter will be `undefined` and a second parameter will contain the parsed content of the file `patch.json` from the installed patch.

installPatch.description: Installs a patch from the given URL. When the patch is successfully installed, it will remain inactive until the application is reloaded.
